00249          : main (server.exe)
00250 
00251   Purpose: Main routine for MIDAS server process. If called one
00252            parameter, it listens for a connection under
00253            MIDAS_TCP_PORT. If a connection is requested, the action
00254            depends on the parameter:
00255 
00256            0: Single process server: This process executes RPC calls
00257               even if there are several connections.
00258 
00259            1: Multi thread server (only Windows NT): For each conn-
00260               ection, a seperate thread is started which servers this
00261               connection.
00262 
00263            2: Multi process server (Not MS-DOS):  For each conn-
00264               ection, a seperate subprocess is started which servers 
00265               this connection. The subprocess is again server.exe, now
00266               with four parameters: the IP address of the calling 
00267               host, the two port numbers used by the calling
00268               host and optionally the name of the experiment to connect
00269               to. With this information it calles back the client.
00270 
00271            This technique is necessary since the usual fork() doesn't
00272            work on some of the supported systems.
00273 
00274   Input:
00275     int  argc               Number of parameters in command line
00276     char **argv             Command line parameters:
00277 
00278                             ip-addr     callback address as longword
00279                             port-no     port number
00280                             program     program name as string
00281                             experiment  experiment name as string
00282 
00283 
00284   Output:
00285     none
00286 
00287   Function value:
00288     BM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
00289 
00290 \********************************************************************/
